GeometryArrays

GeometryArrays: { indices?: IntArrayParam; normals?: FloatArrayParam; positions: FloatArrayParam; primitive?: string; uv?: FloatArrayParam }

GeometryBucketHandle data arrays.

Functions

buildBoxGeometry

  • buildBoxGeometry(cfg?: { center?: number[]; xSize?: number; ySize?: number; zSize?: number }): GeometryArrays
    • Defined in packages/viewer/src/viewer/math/geometry/buildBoxGeometry.ts:48

    Creates box-shaped geometry arrays.

    Usage

    In the example below we'll create a {@link Mesh} with a box-shaped {@link GeometryBucketHandle}.

    [Run this example]

    import {Viewer, Mesh, buildBoxGeometry, GeometryBucketHandle, PhongMaterial, Texture} from "xeokit-viewer.es.js";

const viewer = new Viewer({
        canvasId: "myCanvas"
});

viewer.scene.camera.eye = [0, 0, 5];
viewer.scene.camera.look = [0, 0, 0];
viewer.scene.camera.up = [0, 1, 0];

new Mesh(viewer.scene, {
     geometry: new GeometryBucketHandle(viewer.scene, buildBoxGeometry({
        center: [0,0,0],
        xSize: 1,  // Half-size on each axis
        ySize: 1,
        zSize: 1
     }),
     material: new PhongMaterial(viewer.scene, {
        diffuseMap: new Texture(viewer.scene, {
            src: "textures/diffuse/uvGrid2.jpg"
        })
     })
});
    function

    buildBoxGeometry

    Parameters

    • cfg: { center?: number[]; xSize?: number; ySize?: number; zSize?: number } = ...

      Configs

      • Optional center?: number[]
      • Optional xSize?: number
      • Optional ySize?: number
      • Optional zSize?: number

    Returns GeometryArrays

    GeometryBucketHandle arrays.

buildBoxLinesGeometry

  • buildBoxLinesGeometry(cfg?: { center?: number[] | Float32Array | Float64Array; xSize?: number; ySize?: number; zSize?: number }): GeometryArrays
    • Defined in packages/viewer/src/viewer/math/geometry/buildBoxLinesGeometry.ts:46

    Creates a box-shaped lines {@link Geometry}.

    Usage

    In the example below we'll create a {@link Mesh} with a box-shaped {@link ReadableGeometry} that has lines primitives.

    [Run this example]

    import {Viewer, Mesh, buildBoxLinesGeometry, ReadableGeometry, PhongMaterial} from "xeokit-viewer.es.js";

const viewer = new Viewer({
        canvasId: "myCanvas"
});

viewer.scene.camera.eye = [0, 0, 5];
viewer.scene.camera.look = [0, 0, 0];
viewer.scene.camera.up = [0, 1, 0];

new Mesh(viewer.scene, {
     geometry: new ReadableGeometry(viewer.scene, buildBoxLinesGeometry({
        center: [0,0,0],
        xSize: 1,  // Half-size on each axis
        ySize: 1,
        zSize: 1
     }),
     material: new PhongMaterial(viewer.scene, {
        emissive: [0,1,0]
     })
});
    function

    buildBoxLinesGeometry

    Parameters

    • cfg: { center?: number[] | Float32Array | Float64Array; xSize?: number; ySize?: number; zSize?: number } = ...

      Configs

      • Optional center?: number[] | Float32Array | Float64Array
      • Optional xSize?: number
      • Optional ySize?: number
      • Optional zSize?: number

    Returns GeometryArrays

    Configuration for a {@link Geometry} subtype.

buildCylinderGeometry

  • buildCylinderGeometry(cfg?: { center: number[] | Float32Array | Float64Array; height: number; heightSegments: number; openEnded: boolean; radialSegments: number; radiusBottom: number; radiusTop: number }): GeometryArrays
    • Defined in packages/viewer/src/viewer/math/geometry/buildCylinderGeometry.ts:55

    Creates a cylinder-shaped {@link GeometryBucketHandle}.

    Usage

    Creating a {@link Mesh} with a cylinder-shaped {@link GeometryBucketHandle} :

    [Run this example]

    
import {Viewer, Mesh, buildCylinderGeometry, GeometryBucketHandle, PhongMaterial, Texture} from "xeokit-viewer.es.js";

const viewer = new Viewer({
     canvasId: "myCanvas"
 });

viewer.camera.eye = [0, 0, 5];
viewer.camera.look = [0, 0, 0];
viewer.camera.up = [0, 1, 0];

new Mesh(viewer.scene, {
     geometry: new ReadableGeometry(viewer.scene, buildCylinderGeometry({
         center: [0,0,0],
         radiusTop: 2.0,
         radiusBottom: 2.0,
         height: 5.0,
         radialSegments: 20,
         heightSegments: 1,
         openEnded: false
     }),
     material: new PhongMaterial(viewer.scene, {
        diffuseMap: new Texture(viewer.scene, {
            src: "textures/diffuse/uvGrid2.jpg"
        })
     })
});
    function

    buildCylinderGeometry

    Parameters

    • cfg: { center: number[] | Float32Array | Float64Array; height: number; heightSegments: number; openEnded: boolean; radialSegments: number; radiusBottom: number; radiusTop: number } = ...

      Configs

      • center: number[] | Float32Array | Float64Array
      • height: number
      • heightSegments: number
      • openEnded: boolean
      • radialSegments: number
      • radiusBottom: number
      • radiusTop: number

    Returns GeometryArrays

    Configuration for a {@link GeometryBucketHandle} subtype.

buildEdgeIndices

  • buildEdgeIndices(positions: FloatArrayParam, indices: IntArrayParam, positionsDecompressMatrix: FloatArrayParam, edgeThreshold: number): IntArrayParam
    • Defined in packages/viewer/src/viewer/math/geometry/buildEdgeIndices.ts:106

    Builds edge connectivity indices from a 3D triangle mesh given as vertex positions and triangle indices

    Parameters

    • positions: FloatArrayParam
    • indices: IntArrayParam
    • positionsDecompressMatrix: FloatArrayParam
    • edgeThreshold: number

    Returns IntArrayParam

buildGridGeometry

  • buildGridGeometry(cfg?: { divisions: number; size: number }): GeometryArrays
    • Defined in packages/viewer/src/viewer/math/geometry/buildGridGeometry.ts:44

    Creates a grid-shaped {@link GeometryBucketHandle}.

    Usage

    Creating a {@link Mesh} with a GridGeometry and a {@link PhongMaterial}:

    [Run this example]

    import {Viewer, Mesh, buildGridGeometry, GeometryBucketHandle, PhongMaterial, Texture} from "xeokit-viewer.es.js";

const viewer = new Viewer({
     canvasId: "myCanvas"
});

viewer.camera.eye = [0, 0, 5];
viewer.camera.look = [0, 0, 0];
viewer.camera.up = [0, 1, 0];

new Mesh(viewer.scene, {
     geometry: new GeometryBucketHandle(viewer.scene, buildGridGeometry({
         size: 1000,
         divisions: 500
     })),
     material: new PhongMaterial(viewer.scene, {
         color: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0],
         emissive: [0.4, 0.4, 0.4]
     }),
     position: [0, -1.6, 0]
});
    function

    buildGridGeometry

    Parameters

    • cfg: { divisions: number; size: number } = ...

      Configs

      • divisions: number
      • size: number

    Returns GeometryArrays

    Configuration for a {@link GeometryBucketHandle} subtype.

buildPlaneGeometry

  • buildPlaneGeometry(cfg?: { center: number[]; xSegments: number; xSize: number; zSize: number }): GeometryArrays
    • Defined in packages/viewer/src/viewer/math/geometry/buildPlaneGeometry.ts:50

    Creates a plane-shaped {@link GeometryBucketHandle}.

    Usage

    Creating a {@link Mesh} with a PlaneGeometry and a {@link PhongMaterial} with diffuse {@link Texture}:

    [Run this example]

    import {Viewer, Mesh, buildPlaneGeometry, GeometryBucketHandle, PhongMaterial, Texture} from "xeokit-viewer.es.js";

const viewer = new Viewer({
     canvasId: "myCanvas"
});

viewer.camera.eye = [0, 0, 5];
viewer.camera.look = [0, 0, 0];
viewer.camera.up = [0, 1, 0];

new Mesh(viewer.scene, {
     geometry: new GeometryBucketHandle(viewer.scene, buildPlaneGeometry({
         center: [0,0,0],
         xSize: 2,
         zSize: 2,
         xSegments: 10,
         zSegments: 10
     }),
     material: new PhongMaterial(viewer.scene, {
         diffuseMap: new Texture(viewer.scene, {
             src: "textures/diffuse/uvGrid2.jpg"
         })
     })
 });
    function

    buildPlaneGeometry

    Parameters

    • cfg: { center: number[]; xSegments: number; xSize: number; zSize: number } = ...

      Configs

      • center: number[]
      • xSegments: number
      • xSize: number
      • zSize: number

    Returns GeometryArrays

    Configuration for a {@link GeometryBucketHandle} subtype.

buildSphereGeometry

  • buildSphereGeometry(cfg?: { center: number[]; heightSegments: number; radius: number; widthSegments: number }): GeometryArrays
    • Defined in packages/viewer/src/viewer/math/geometry/buildSphereGeometry.ts:48

    Creates a sphere-shaped {@link GeometryBucketHandle}.

    Usage

    Creating a {@link Mesh} with a sphere-shaped {@link GeometryBucketHandle} :

    [Run this example]

    import {Viewer, Mesh, buildSphereGeometry, GeometryBucketHandle, PhongMaterial, Texture} from "xeokit-viewer.es.js";

const viewer = new Viewer({
    canvasId: "myCanvas"
});

viewer.camera.eye = [0, 0, 5];
viewer.camera.look = [0, 0, 0];
viewer.camera.up = [0, 1, 0];

new Mesh(viewer.scene, {
     geometry: new GeometryBucketHandle(viewer.scene, buildSphereGeometry({
         center: [0,0,0],
         radius: 1.5,
         heightSegments: 60,
         widthSegments: 60
     }),
     material: new PhongMaterial(viewer.scene, {
        diffuseMap: new Texture(viewer.scene, {
            src: "textures/diffuse/uvGrid2.jpg"
        })
     })
});
    function

    buildSphereGeometry

    Parameters

    • cfg: { center: number[]; heightSegments: number; radius: number; widthSegments: number } = ...

      Configs

      • center: number[]
      • heightSegments: number
      • radius: number
      • widthSegments: number

    Returns GeometryArrays

    Configuration for a {@link GeometryBucketHandle} subtype.

buildTorusGeometry

  • buildTorusGeometry(cfg?: { arc?: number; center?: number[]; radialSegments?: number; radius?: number; tube?: number; tubeSegments?: number }): GeometryArrays
    • Defined in packages/viewer/src/viewer/math/geometry/buildTorusGeometry.ts:52

    Creates a torus-shaped {@link GeometryBucketHandle}.

    Usage

    Creating a {@link Mesh} with a torus-shaped {@link GeometryBucketHandle} :

    [Run this example]

    import {Viewer, Mesh, buildTorusGeometry, GeometryBucketHandle, PhongMaterial, Texture} from "xeokit-viewer.es.js";

const viewer = new Viewer({
     canvasId: "myCanvas"
});

viewer.camera.eye = [0, 0, 5];
viewer.camera.look = [0, 0, 0];
viewer.camera.up = [0, 1, 0];

new Mesh(viewer.scene, {
     geometry: new GeometryBucketHandle(viewer.scene, buildTorusGeometry({
         center: [0,0,0],
         radius: 1.0,
         tube: 0.5,
         radialSegments: 32,
         tubeSegments: 24,
         arc: Math.PI * 2.0
     }),
     material: new PhongMaterial(viewer.scene, {
        diffuseMap: new Texture(viewer.scene, {
            src: "textures/diffuse/uvGrid2.jpg"
        })
     })
});
    function

    buildTorusGeometry

    Parameters

    • cfg: { arc?: number; center?: number[]; radialSegments?: number; radius?: number; tube?: number; tubeSegments?: number } = ...

      Configs

      • Optional arc?: number
      • Optional center?: number[]
      • Optional radialSegments?: number
      • Optional radius?: number
      • Optional tube?: number
      • Optional tubeSegments?: number

    Returns GeometryArrays

    Configuration for a {@link GeometryBucketHandle} subtype.

buildVectorTextGeometry

  • buildVectorTextGeometry(cfg?: { origin: number[]; size: number; text: string }): GeometryArrays
    • Defined in packages/viewer/src/viewer/math/geometry/buildVectorTextGeometry.ts:1623

    Creates wireframe vector text {@link Geometry}.

    Usage

    Creating a {@link Mesh} with vector text {@link ReadableGeometry} :

    [Run this example]

    
import {Viewer, Mesh, buildVectorTextGeometry, ReadableGeometry, PhongMaterial} from "xeokit-viewer.es.js";

const viewer = new Viewer({
     canvasId: "myCanvas"
});

viewer.camera.eye = [0, 0, 100];
viewer.camera.look = [0, 0, 0];
viewer.camera.up = [0, 1, 0];

new Mesh(viewer.scene, {
     geometry: new ReadableGeometry(viewer.scene, buildVectorTextGeometry({
         origin: [0,0,0],
         text: "On the other side of the screen, it all looked so easy"
     }),
     material: new PhongMaterial(viewer.scene, {
        diffuseMap: new Texture(viewer.scene, {
            src: "textures/diffuse/uvGrid2.jpg"
        })
     })
});
    function

    buildVectorTextGeometry

    Parameters

    • cfg: { origin: number[]; size: number; text: string } = ...

      Configs

      • origin: number[]
      • size: number
      • text: string

    Returns GeometryArrays

    Configuration for a {@link Geometry} subtype.
